docker.services: npm run dev and dotnet run both active

testSuites.name: demo-working-login.spec.ts
testSuites.description: Simple demonstration of working Mantine UI login
keyFindings: ✅ page.fill() method works reliably with Mantine components
✅ CSS warnings from Mantine are properly filtered as non-blocking
✅ Wrong selectors (name attributes) properly fail as expected

issue.description: AuthHelper fails with API call errors
issue.specificError: Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 (Not Found)
issue.rootCause: AuthHelper likely making incorrect API calls or expecting different endpoints
issue.impact: Helper utility fails but core login approach still works

workingApproach.browsers: All (Chrome, Firefox, WebKit, Mobile Chrome, Mobile Safari)

failedApproach.reason: LoginPage.tsx doesn't use name attributes, only data-testid

examples: Warning: Unsupported style property &:focus-visible. Did you mean &:focusVisible?

consoleErrorAnalysis.conclusion: CSS warnings from Mantine do NOT block login functionality

forE2ETests: ✅ Use page.fill() method for Mantine form inputs
✅ Ignore Mantine CSS warnings in console error filtering
✅ Wait for specific navigation URLs rather than generic timeouts
❌ Avoid input[name] selectors (not implemented in components)
⚠️ Fix AuthHelper API integration issues before using helper functions
forDevelopers: ✅ The core login approach is solid and production-ready
✅ Mantine UI components work correctly with Playwright
⚠️ AuthHelper needs debugging for API endpoint integration
✅ CSS warnings are expected and don't impact functionality

immediate: Document the working data-testid selector approach
Update all existing E2E tests to use this proven pattern
Create standardized login helper using direct page.fill() approach
mediumTerm: Debug and fix AuthHelper API integration issues
Test login with other user types (teacher, member, vetted, guest)

artifacts.testResults: 15/15 demo tests passed, 0/30 helper tests passed
artifacts.consoleOutput: Captured CSS warning examples and error analysis

executionSummary.keySuccess: data-testid selector approach works reliably across all browsers
executionSummary.criticalFinding: Mantine CSS warnings do not block login functionality
executionSummary.mainIssue: AuthHelper utility needs API integration fixes
